Articles.Content:
Jeb was flying his plane when Dancott Kerman, who was just enjoying skydiving came directly in the path of the plane. Jeb didn't realize it until there was a loud noise and green powder came out the back of the plane.

Gene Kerman.

Coffee overdose.

Gene loved coffee. More than his kids, more than his job. One night he had a bit too much and could not sleep. The next day, while on the job, he was exhausted. He accidentally drove off the road on the KSC and hurtled towards a fuel tank and exploded. His last words were, “woah there bud.”

Kai Kerman

Too many SRBs

Edited March 30, 2021 by STORMPILOTkerbalkind

Kai was going to launch on the new rocket: SRB-100. As the name states, it uses SRBs to get to the Mun and back. Somebody forgot to add a strut to one of the boosters and as the rocket launched, it turned into a firework show and Kai was no more.

Naeth Kerman

Misplaced Wrench

Edited March 30, 2021 by Naeth Kerman

11 hours ago, STORMPILOTkerbalkind said:

 

Naeth Kerman was one of the VAB workers. One day he was very tired at work, and when it was time to go home he forgot where he had left his wrench.

(In the wrong place)

Turns out he had left the wrench inside one of the engines for tomorrow's Mun rocket.

When he was watching that rocket's launch, he remembered where he had left it. It was too late. The rocket exploded due to an item inside the first stage engine.

Don't worry, the launch was unmanned. But debris of it flew everywhere, including the crowd watching the launch.

Almost everyone survived with only a startle. But a certain Naeth Kerman was hit in the head by a wrench wich mysteriously was among the debris.

What Kerman will die due to faking the Mun landing on Duna

Edited March 30, 2021 by Maria Sirona
I accidentally was at the wrong page

7 hours ago, Naeth Kerman said:

Naeth Kerman

Misplaced Wrench

Naeth was a pilot selected for Hyperion 1. During pod assembly, a workKerman left a wrench (or spanner, whatever) inside the command pod, in a small storage compartment just over the commander's seat. Nobody noticed it because this being the first test mission didn't carry any science. During launch, the little cubbyhole somehow opened, and the wrench dropped on to Naeth, impaling both of his eyes at 2 Gs. Naeth, now blind, jerked the control stick in a panic. This resulted in aerodynamic stresses overcoming the rocket leading to an in-flight breakup. He died in the resulting fireball, as being a kerbal creation the Hyperion launcher/spacecraft combo didn't have an LES.

Neble Kerman, freak accident with Kerbonaut Complex self-service dryer

Edited March 30, 2021 by OrdinaryKerman

Nebel was walking over to the self service dryer to go dry her hands. However Jeb used it before her, and one of Jebs socks was stuck in there. When Nebel used it the sock shot out and nocked her out of the building, through the window, and  into the path of a landing plane, she was killed instantly.

cause: clone-inator 9000 on a rocket

40 minutes ago, JcoolTheShipbuilder said:

Gru Kerman 

cause: clone-inator 9000 on a rocket

 

Gru Kerman was being sent on a mission. His rocket carried the clone-inator 9000, an advanced model of the cloning machine that killed Bill earlier.

Once Gru got into orbit, he started experimenting with it. Unfortunately, the clone-inator 9000 was very power-hungry. Just the startup of it caused all electricity to drain- including energy from the life support systems. Before Gru could switch the clone-inator 9000 off, he had already suffocated.

 

Random Kerman will die on Kandora while driving a Kavatar (yeah, watched Avatar recently)

He jumped out of the door- and one of the engines sucked Jim right in.

57 minutes ago, Maria Sirona said:

JB182 already did Robbert. You should have done

i know, he posted it at the same time as me

Kermain Kerman was Head of Operations at Woomerang. There weren't many launches there, and those rockets that did launch here often were of very little importance and used outdated equipment. So when he came to work that day, he was pleasantly surprised by the appearance of a Unity launcher carrying a boilerplate capsule. Time to launch... Ignition... 3... 2... 1... nothing. The engines just cut off on their own before spooling up. After confirmation from flight and ground computers that the rocket was now in safe mode, Kermain led an engineering team down to the pad to figure out what went wrong. While they were still driving to the pad, the launcher's abort system fired. Even with all decouplers disarmed, it still had enough force to rip the CSM out of its fairing. When they arrived at the pad, pressure readouts showed that booster 2's engine was somehow still running despite producing barely any thrust. then suddenly,
BOOM!

Kermain and his team perished in the blast.

If you can't tell, this was based very lightly on the Nedelin Disaster.

 

Daymun Kerman had been on a normal orbital mission to the KSS, when a kraken attack flung her at 50% lightspeed into Kerbol. The immense G-forces crushed her body and squeezed out all the liquids, turning her into a splatter against her seat. Kerbol's heat quickly dried the splatter, preventing it from soaking too much into the seat. She got to the photosphere (the closest thing stars have to a 'surface') when the capsule broke up completely, releasing all that was left of her into the sun. Those bits then vaporized in nanoseconds.

 

Pete Hawkerman, killed by terrorist mob in front of KSC Admin

Edited April 5, 2021 by OrdinaryKerman
Apologies to Peter Hawkins, first voice of the Daleks
